topic.title: Sample Code
topic.shortdesc: The C SDK now lets you create users, assign them roles and associated privileges, and remove them from the system.

section.title: User-Management APIs
section.p: Users who have been assigned the Admin role for the cluster are able to create, edit, and remove users. The C SDK provides APIs to support these activities. A high-level summary of the APIs can be found in User-Management.

section.title: C User-Management Example
section.p: The following code-example demonstrates how the user-management APIs can be used. It assumes that Couchbase Server is established on 10.111.170.101; that the Full Administrator username and password are Administrator and password respectively; and that the travel-sample bucket is installed. For information on installing the travel-sample bucket, see Install Sample Buckets.
section.note: Use of the Full Administrator username and password gives an application complete access to all resources within the Couchbase Server-environment: use of the Full Administrator username and password may therefore be useful during code-development. However, for production purposes, the Full Administrator username and password should only be used when absolutely essential: in all other circumstances, the specified username and password should correspond to some lesser role, which appropriately delimits access to server-resources. Creation of such a role, and the establishment of its associated username and password, is demonstrated in the following code-example.
